April 13th - 14th
UB Hacking - University at Buffalo
24 Hour Hackathon

UB Hacking is a 24 hour hackathon hosted at SUNY Buffalo by the UB ACM. It is a hackathon for students by students. We want to see students bring their awesome ideas to reality. UB Hacking will provide meals for the entirety of the hackathon, a place to nap (if you really need to), awesome free swag, and prize money and more!

UB Hacking took place over Saturday April 13 - Sunday April 14. Our full list of winners is on our prizes page. First place was taken home by GamePute. Second place was awarded to ARcampus. And Where You Looking At claimed third place!

What we do.

24 Hours of Code

You only have 24 hours to hack on your great idea. You're stressed for time, but you know you gotta make it happen. We'll provide breakfast, lunches, dinners, snacks, and drinks. We also secured you a few places to sleep too, but we'll throw swag at you too to keep you going!

Awesome Prizes

This year, we are giving out $2000 for the top teams and have even more API and other prizes!

For All Students

We're inviting more than just SUNY Buffalo students this year. If you're in the area, you should register! UB Hacking is open to both undergraduates and graduates. Remember, this event is completely free!

Sponsors

Interested in sponsoring? Read our sponsorship packet and feel free to send us an email at contact@ubhacking.com if you have any questions.
